Assign Version Label

Use the Assign Version Label dialog box (Actions | Version Label | Assign) to attach a descriptive label to a specific revision.

Field Descriptions

General Tab
Assign version label Enter the version label you want to assign to the revision. Do not use an asterisk (*), a colon (:), double quotes ("), a plus sign (+), or a minus sign (-). Names are limited to 254 characters.
To revision To assign a version label to a revision other than the default revision, enter the revision number. You can also click the Browse button to select a specific revision.
Float label with tip Select to keep the version label assigned to the latest (tip) revision. Click here for more information on floating labels.
If version label exists If an identical version label already exists, select:

Prompt to prompt for confirmation before overwriting the version label,
Reassign to reassign the version label without prompting, or
Don't Reassign to prevent the version label from being overwritten.
Include files in subproject This field is only available if a project is selected. Select to add the version label to all files within subprojects of the selected project.
Selected Files Tab
File list Review the files selected to have a version label assigned.
Properties button Click to display archive, configuration file, and workspace information for the selected files or projects.


See Also
